channel.title: CiTR -- Weners Barbeque
channel.description: Tune in each week to hear Daryl Wener talk about the world of sports. Weners BBQ will discuss everything from the Vancouver Canucks to the World Rock Paper and Scissors Championship. Your calls are welcome and I hope you enjoy listening.
channel.itunes:summary: Tune in each week to hear Daryl Wener talk about the world of sports. Weners BBQ will discuss everything from the Vancouver Canucks to the World Rock Paper and Scissors Championship. Your calls are welcome and I hope you enjoy listening.
channel.itunes:author: CiTR 101.9 Vancouver
channel.itunes:subtitle: Tune in each week to hear Daryl Wener talk about the world of sports.

item.title: Broadcast on 19-Feb-2008
item.description:
Hey Guys. Thanks for tuning in today.
The Show is: Graham Bath and Jordan Yu from the Men's Basketball Team. Cait Haggarty from the Women's Basketball Team. Doug Reimer who is the Coach of the Women's Volleyball Team. Clare Hanna to talk about the Men's Volleyball Team and Milan Dragecevic, the Coach of the Men's Hockey Team. Lots of Oscar talk with these people who really hadn't seen any of the movies. I also had people trying to recognize TV Show theme songs. Hope you like it.

item.description: Sorry for not a full podcast this week. Was a problem with the CiTR Podcast set up so I only have the last 30 minutes of the show this week. Starts with an interview with UBC Basketball Players and Coach Brent Malish and Vern Knopp. Giulio Caravatta- BC Lions Color Commentator BJ Bass- my NFL correspondent and Darren Watts- former UBC Baseball Player and Former Pro Ballplayer with some Baseball talk. Some good stuff on A-Rod.

item.description:

On the Show today: Dan Elliott- UBC Football Talk, Vern Knopp and Chris Dyck- Assistant Coach and Player from the UBC Men's Basketball Team, Jamie Campbell from Sportsnet, BJ Bass- NFL Talk Brian John's- Former TBird Great and two time Olympic Swimmer and of course Giulio Caravatta- BC Lions Color Commentator

item.title: Broadcast on 16-Oct-2007
item.description:
Jeff Francis is on this show. Yesterday the Colorado Rockies beat the Arizona Diamondbacks to clinch a spot in the World Series. Jeff will be pitching the opener next Wednesday at either Cleveland or Fenway Park. Cav Whitely, Jeff's former teammate and current assistant coach for the UBC Baseball team came on to help with the interview. One of my favorite interviews ever.
Also: Milan Dragecevic- Coach for the Men's Hockey Team Stephanie Thibert from the Women's Soccer Team BJ Bass- some NFL Talk Giulio Caravatta- BC Lions Color Commentator
The musician today: Dan Mangan
item.itunes:subtitle: Jeff Francis

item.title: Broadcast on 04-Sep-2007
item.description:
A really really fun show
Started out with Freshman Forward Graham Bath and Point Guard Alex Murphy from the UBC Basketball Team
Then in came the two seniors from the UBC Women's Basketball Team- Cait Haggarty and Erica McGuinness
Then things got really fun Evan Goldberg, writer and Executive Producer from Superbad joined me. Neat, lots of inside stuff about Superbad
And, Pre Recorded from Glasgow, Christopher Mintz-Plasse, AKA McLovin. He even told me about the new movie he's making. Check out how he did on my Canadian Quiz
Mr Vegas, BJ Bass joined the fray to talk Canucks Jersey's and NFL Football and Finally, Bud Collins with some US Open Tennis Talk live from Flushing Meadows.
Big thanks to the Loose Change Trio Band for coming in. They played live songs at 4:30, 5:00, after McLovin and about 6:10 to close the show There new Album is 'Unstruck and will be be out February of 2008 www.myspace.com/thedavidwardtrio
Questions or comments please email me at ethanwener@hotmail.com

item.itunes:subtitle: Tuesday, January 23rd

item.title: Broadcast on 16-Jan-2007
item.description:
Today's show- which opened with a great clip of Drawn's Together's Judge Fudge, centered around UBC Basketball.
The show started with me yacking away and then Casey Archibald and Assistant Coach Vern Knopp of the UBC Thunderbird Men's Basketball Team showed up. We talked about last Friday's loss in Brandon. The defeat snapped the Birds' 33 game regular season Conference winning streak. We also broke down this weekend's big matchup at UVIC. The Brids' are the #6 in the country and UVIC is #9. UBC is 14-1, UVIC 13-2. It will be the second and third matchups of the season between the rivals, with UBC winning the first tilt at War Memorial just before the Christmas Break. First Place in the division will be on the line. Casey was not happy that I made UVIC a 4 point favorite.
Keeping things rolling- after playing the Mary Tyler Moore Theme Song, Howard Tsumura from the Vancouver Province joined me, and we broke down the UBC/UVIC Men's Games, what Brandon's wins meant to the Canada West Playoff picture, and many topics about the UBC Basketball Team. Howard agrees with me that a 4 point UVIC spread sounded right and thinks the teams will split the weekend.
Next up- after some Scooby Doo music, it was time for Brad Zannon from the UBC Men's Hockey Team to come on the show. Brad had a great weekend getting 4 goals and 1 assist in UBC 's weekend split versus Regina. It was Saturday where Brad really shined, netting 3 goals in the second period in UBC's come from behind 6-4 win against the Cougars. Did I mention Brad was a defencemen? Brad's performance earned him Canada West Men's Hockey Player of the Week. Great to have him on.
After that- the star of our show, an interview with Jim Robson was played. It was replayed from our pre game show on Friday Night and was done by myself and Mike Wall. It's about 15 minutes, he's great, and I think it's a pretty cool interview. The sound quality is a little poor as we were having a tough time with our studio computers.
After that, it was time for Football Talk. I previewed the Conference Finals matchups and reviewed the Divisional Finals. How did the Chargers lose that game? Seahawks- they had it coming. I've got the Colts and Bears winning this weekend.
Thanks for listening, you really don't have anything better to do?
item.itunes:subtitle: Tuesday, January 16th- Jim Robson

item.title: Broadcast on 09-Jan-2007
item.description:
Chris Dyck and Vern Knopp from the UBC Basketball Team were in here talking about the wins versus SFU, and this weekends matchups at Brandon and Regina.
Wilson Wong went over the 12-1 UBC Women's Basketball team's weekend against SFU.
Mitch Bartley from the UBC Men's Hockey team was on the phone, I went over the Baseball Hall of Fame Voting- no McGwrire (good thing), and the Road Hockey Rumble boys were on the phone promoting their new show- was fun. Ended with BJ from Vegas- always a good time.
Thanks for listening, have a great day everybody
item.itunes:subtitle: Januray 9th, 2006

item.title: Broadcast on 28-Nov-2006
item.description: Verne Knopp and Casey Archibald were in studio talk about the Big Game this weekend in Men's Basketball vs UVIC. From their we had Mikey Wall with some UBC hockey talk. That was followed by Steve Ewen as we discussed the Baseball Hall of Fame Ballot. Neither want or think Mark McGwire will be elected this year. Lastly, BJ Bass from Las Vegas was on the phone, with NFL talk.
item.itunes:subtitle: November 28

item.title: Broadcast on 21-Nov-2006
item.description:
Thanks for tuning in.
On the show today we had Assistant Coach Randy Knorr and Guard Brett Leversage from the UBC Men's Basketball Team. 8-0 and looking good. Mikey Wall joined us, and we discussed some UBC Hockey. at 5pm- Javy Glatt from the BC Lions- Grey Cup Winning BC Lions, came by and then Guilio Carravatta talked about the Grey Cup. BJ Bass with some NFL Football talked, and were out.
item.itunes:subtitle: Grey Cup Show

item.title: Broadcast on 07-Nov-2006
item.description: I will have an update on this show soon. Hopefully. It involves me getting around to it. I am very lazy.
item.itunes:subtitle: November 7th, 2006

item.title: Broadcast on 31-Oct-2006
item.description:
Wilson Wong started the show and we rambled. Then Vern Knopp and Jason Birring of the UBC Men's Basketball team hit the airwaves and we went over the weekend, and previewed their next games. What a win- 130-128 vs Trinity Western in triple ot on the Friday.
Wilson then came back, we talked all UBC.
Dave Chernychan from News 1130AM talked Canucks, Gulio Carravatta with some BC Lions Football, I talked some more and the show was over.
Thanks for listening everybody.
item.itunes:subtitle: Happy Halloween

item.title: Broadcast on 24-Oct-2006
item.description: Sorry for the late update. On the show today we had Wilson Wong in studio breaking down various UBC Sporting topics. At 4:45- Vern Knopp and Casey Archibald stopped by and we previewed the UBC Thunderbirds Mens Basketball season openers against Trinity Western and SFU on the weekend. Onto the Barbeque session- Dave Chernychan from News 1130 gave us some NHL/Canucks talk, Steve Ewen with some baseball and the one and only Gulio Carravatta with some Lions/CFL talk. I did this post one week later, hopefully it was accurate.
item.itunes:subtitle: Tuesday, October 24th

item.title: Broadcast on 17-Oct-2006
item.description: A fun show today. Wilson Wong was here to talk UBC Athletics with us. We covered a lot of sports. Vern Knopp, assistant UBC Men's Basketball was here and then we broke into the Barbeque. Talked Baseball- I hate the Wild Card, and I praised the Tigers. Did some Canucks talk, Gulio Caravatta was on per usual and we talked more baseball, the Miami Brawl, and the CFL. Hank Williams JR- Family Tradition- oh yeah
item.itunes:subtitle: October 17, 2006

item.title: Broadcast on 10-Oct-2006
item.description: Thanks for listening to another edition of the BBQ. Had a little Podcast trouble with the first hour so you'll have to deal with a "mere" hour. On the show today: Bill Plunkett from the Orange County Register (he covers the Dodgers), and lifelong Detroit Tigers fan, gave us his take on the LCS's, Yankees, and Dodgers. He thinks with Joe Torre staying put in New York, that ARod will be gone by next season. Dodgers in 2007. I talked hockey- Nucks play the Wild tonight, and Gulio Carravata came by as usual with some Leos talk. What a win vs Calgary on the weekend. I talked NFL, and that was that.
item.itunes:subtitle: Wener's Barbeque October 10th

item.title: Broadcast on 03-Oct-2006
item.description:
Hope you enjoy the show. On Wener's Barbeque today we had a preview of the UBC Men's Hockey Team with CiTR play by play guru Mike Wall. CiTR will have UBC's first game at 7:15pm on Friday. TBird QB Blake Smelser also stopped by and we chatted a little Birds Football. Schrum Bowl takes place this Saturday at 2pm. The NHL starts tomorrow and I was lucky enough to have Cliff Ronning on the show, while Gulio Carravata made my day with some BC Lions Chatter. Lastly, my main man BJ Bass came on the show, and Mr Las Vegas ran down the NFL with me. He actually thinks Terrell Owens will have a big day in Philly next weekend.
Not enough baseball for my liking, but they only give me an hour and a half.
GO DODGERS!!!!!!
item.itunes:subtitle: Cliff Ronning, Football
